required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Post-marketing Study Using Commercially Approved Biosense Webster (BWI) Medical Devices for the Treatment of Participants With Cardiac Arrhythmias
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Post-marketing Study for Evaluation of Ongoing Safety and Effectiveness of Catheter Mapping and Ablation Using Commercially Approved BWI Medical Devices for the Treatment of Patients With Cardiac Arrhythmias

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to prospectively collect clinical data evaluating the ongoing safety and performance during routine-use standard cardiac arrhythmia mapping and/or ablation procedures while using commercial Biosense Webster Inc. (BWI) medical devices. Data generated from the study will be used to confirm safety and performance of BWI medical devices in the marketed phase and to expand the body of evidence on the use of these devices and techniques in treatment of cardiac arrhythmias.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Primary Adverse Events (PAEs) Related to Device in Scope and/or Study Procedure Within 7 Days of the Initial Study Procedure
primary_outcome.description: Primary Adverse Events include device or procedure related death, Atrio-Esophageal Fistula, Severe Pulmonary Vein Stenosis, Cardiac Tamponade/ perforation, Thromboembolism, Pericarditis, Stroke/ Cerebrovascular Accident, Transient Ischemic Attach, Phrenic Nerve Paralysis (permanent), Myocardial Infarction ,Major Vascular Access Complication/ Bleeding, Heart Block (permanent).

primary_outcome.measure: Atrial Fibrillation (AF): Number of Participants with Isolation of all Targeted Pulmonary Veins
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with isolation (entrance block confirmation) of all targeted pulmonary veins will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: SupraVentricular Tachycardia (SVT) (Sinus Nodal Re-entrant Tachycardia, Focal AT, Multifocal AT, AVNRT, Non Re-entrant Junctional Tachycardias): Number of Participants with Non-inducibility of the Targeted Tachycardia Post-ablation
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with sinus nodal re-entrant tachycardia, focal atrial tachycardia (AT) multifocal AT, atrioventricular nodal reentry tachycardia (AVNRT), non re-entrant junctional tachycardias with non-inducibility of the targeted tachycardia post-ablation will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: SVT (MRAT): Number of Participants with Complete Bidirectional Conduction Block Across the Ablation Line
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Macro Re-entrant Atrial Tachycardia (MRAT) with complete bidirectional conduction block across the ablation line will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: SVT (AVRT): Number of Participants with Complete Block of Accessory Pathway
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with atrioventricular reentry tachycardia (AVRT) with complete block of accessory pathway will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Device and/or Procedure-Related Serious Adverse Events (Serious Adverse Device Effects [SADEs])
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with device and/or procedure-related Serious Adverse Events (Serious Adverse Device Effects, SADEs) within 7 days (early-onset), >7-30 days (peri-procedural) and >30 days (late onset) following the initial study procedure will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Device and/or Procedure-Related Non-Serious Adverse Events (Non-Serious Adverse Device Effects [ADEs])
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with device and/or procedure-related non-serious adverse events (Non-serious adverse device effects [ADEs]) within 7 days (early-onset), > 7-30 Days (peri-procedural) and >30 Days (Late Onset) following the initial study procedure will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: AF: Number of Participants with Acute Reconnection Among all Targeted Pulmonary Veins (PVs)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Acute reconnection among all targeted PVs will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: SVT (MRAT): Number of Participants with Non-inducibility of the Targeted Tachycardia Post-ablation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with MRAT with non-inducibility of the targeted tachycardia post-ablation will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: SVT (AVNRT): Number of Participants with Elimination or Modification of Slow Pathway Conduction
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with AVNRT with elimination or modification of slow pathway conduction will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: AF: Number of Participants with Documented (Symptomatic and Asymptomatic) AF, AT, Atrial Flutter (AFL) Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with documented (symptomatic and asymptomatic) AF, AT, AFL episodes (episodes greater than or equal to [>=] 30 seconds) post-blanking will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: AF: Number of Participants with Documented Symptomatic AF, AT, AFL Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with documented symptomatic AF, AT, AFL episodes (episodes >= 30 seconds) post-blanking will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: AF: Number of Participants with Repeated Ablation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with repeated ablation post-blanking will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: AF: Number of Participants with Repeated Ablation with Pulmonary Vein (PV) Reconnection
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with repeated ablation with PV reconnection post blanking will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: AF: Change in AF Burden Compared to Baseline for Participants with Continuous Arrhythmia Monitoring
secondary_outcome.description: AF burden will be measured as the change in the percentage of time that participants will be in AF (symptomatic and asymptomatic) compared to baseline will be calculated. The change in AF burden for the overall study population will be calculated and expressed.

secondary_outcome.measure: SVT: Number of Participants with Recurrence of Documented Arrhythmia of the Targeted SVT
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with recurrence of documented arrhythmia of the targeted SVT (episodes >=30 seconds) will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: SVT: Number of Participants with Documented Arrhythmia of new SVT, not Targeted During Index Procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with documented arrhythmia of new SVT, not targeted during index procedure will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: SVT: Number of Participants with Repeated Ablation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with repeated ablation will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: SVT: Change in Study Arrhythmia Burden Compared to Baseline for Participants with Continuous Arrhythmia Monitoring
secondary_outcome.description: Study arrhythmia burden will be measured as the change in the percentage of time that participants will be in study arrhythmia (symptomatic and asymptomatic) compared to baseline will be calculated. The change in study arrhythmia for the overall study population will be calculated and expressed.

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with cardiac arrhythmias who are scheduled to undergo an ablation procedure in routine clinical practice for management of their arrhythmia with a BWI therapeutic catheter will be observed.

intervention.description: Participants will be treated with commercially approved BWI medical devices following routine clinical practice. No specific intervention will be observed for this study.

study_pop.textblock: Study population consists of participants diagnosed with cardiac arrhythmias who are scheduled to undergo an ablation procedure for management of their arrhythmia with a per-protocol defined Biosense Webster Inc (BWI) therapeutic catheter.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
- Diagnosed with paroxysmal or persistent Atrial Fibrillation (AF) or supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) and scheduled to undergo an ablation procedure for management of their arrhythmia with a per-protocol defined BW therapeutic catheter
- Able and willing to comply with all pre-, post- and follow-up testing and requirements as per hospital standard of care
- Signed Patient Informed Consent Form (ICF)
Exclusion criteria:
- Currently participating in an interventional (drug, device, biologic, etc.) clinical trial
- Life expectancy of less than 12-months
- Presenting any contra-indication for the use of BWI Commercially approved medical devices, as indicated in the respective IFU or User Manuals

patient_data.ipd_description: Johnson & Johnson Medical Device Companies have an agreement with the Yale Open Data Access (YODA) Project to serve as the independent review panel for evaluation of requests for clinical study reports and participant level data from investigators and physicians for scientific research that will advance medical knowledge and public health. Requests for access to the study data can be submitted through the YODA Project site at http://yoda.yale.edu
